content: President Obama is proposing cutting the budget by 100 million dollars or apx. .003% of next years budget. I don't see this as doing any good at all. Probably a weak answer to the Tea Parties. Even Paul Krugman of the New York Times is not impressed: “'Pretty soon, even here in Washington, it adds up to real money’,” says the president. Except, you know, really it doesn’t. Let’s say the administration finds $100 million in efficiencies every working day for the rest of the Obama administration’s first term. That’s still around $80 billion, or around 2% of one year’s federal spending. OK, politics is theater. But you could argue that the president shouldn’t feed the bogus claim that we can close fiscal gaps by eliminating a bit of waste.” "http://features.csmonitor.com/politics/2009/04/21/obamas-100-million-budget-cut-amounts-to-a-cup-of-coffee/" Is anyone impressed with what the President calls "real money?" And the proposed amount is aa "target" for lawmakers to try to attain.... Comments?
reply: President Obama is proposing cutting the budget by 100 million dollars or apx. .003% of next years budget. I don't see this as doing any good at all. Probably a weak answer to the Tea Parties. Let’s say the administration finds $100 million in efficiencies every working day for the rest of the Obama administration’s first term. That’s still around $80 billion, or around 2% of one year’s federal spending. OK, politics is theater. But you could argue that the president shouldn’t feed the bogus claim that we can close fiscal gaps by eliminating a bit of waste.” "http://features.csmonitor.com/politics/2009/04/21/obamas-100-million-budget-cut-amounts-to-a-cup-of-coffee/" Is anyone impressed with what the President calls "real money?" content: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: President Obama is proposing cutting the budget by 100 million dollars or apx. .003% of next years budget. a well timed statement after the tea party's... for the clueless and uninformed it sounds great intil you take out the calulator and start punching numbers..... notice he didn't mention cutting any of the billions in earmarks he approved. Sooooooo, billions in earmarks going to go forward.... millions cut in office supplies... hmmmmmmmmm, vlery-in-ter-est-ting. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: quote: My guess is that you will whine no matter what happens. That's your opinion but think back to the Obama bailouts. Billions were given/lent to companies who, in turn, paid out over 100 million in bonuses. This angered many. Those who agreed with the President pointed out how these bonuses were just a drop in the bucket. Now compare the cuts to the multi trillion dollar budget and, well, I'm not impressed...
quote: My guess is that you will whine no matter what happens.

content: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: quote: My guess is that you will whine no matter what happens. That's your opinion but think back to the Obama bailouts. content: quote: How much whining has there been about "pork"? How much is "pork" as a percentage of the total budget? My guess is that you will whine no matter what happens. Just for argumets sake let's say wasteful spending, AKA PORK, makes uponly 3% and you know it's GOT TO BE MORE. The cuts that the President is trying to get are .003% of the total budget. He will, IF SUCESSFUL cut one thousandth of the pork from the budget. I can almost hear the tax protesters cheering already!
